angstd.ui.views.view
Class AbstractView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              angstd.ui.views.view.AbstractView
All Implemented Interfaces:
View, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DomainView
public abstract class AbstractView
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements View

AbstractView is the basic implementation for the View interface. It defines all methods for the handling of a view and its embedding panel. (Look also into View for more details)

This class also defines the paintComponent(Graphics) method which starts the view rendering by invoking render(Graphics). When rendering the view the rendering hints as well as the zoom transformation are set. Then the abstract method renderView() is called which has to be implemented by a subclass, for instance DomainView. After the view was rendered this class calls the render method for each additionally added renderer (this could for instance be a DomainTooltipRenderer.
Those additionally renderer can be added by using the addRenderer(Renderer) method.

A ZoomController is added to this class which controls the zoom activity on this view. Basically a AffineTransformation is calculated which is applied to the graphics context when rendering the view. For more details on the ZoomController, see ZoomController.

The views information object storing important view information such as its unique id is also provided by this class.

Some general methods for the layout process (setting the views width and height) are also provided by this class.

Author:
Andreas Held
See Also:
Serialized Form

getViewComponent

public javax.swing.JComponent getViewComponent()
Returns the real view component. This is used to split the view component from a component that is returned by getComponent().

For example, getComponent() might return a ScrollPane that contains the JComponent returned by this method.

Specified by:

render

public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
Renders the view. If the view is within zoom mode the calculated and needed zoom transformation is requested from the ZoomController and set to the graphics context at the beginning of the rendering process.

This method iterates over the list of active renderer and paints all renderer and the view.

Delegates to renderView(Graphics2D) where the view itself is rendered.

Specified by:
render in interface View
Parameters:
g - the graphics object on which is used for rendering the view

renderView

public abstract void renderView(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
The view rendering for subclasses, e.g. DomainView

Parameters:
g - the graphics context used to render the view

isZoomMode

public boolean isZoomMode()
Wrapper around the ZoomControllers isZoomMode method. Returns whether or not the view is in zoom mode.

Specified by:
isZoomMode in interface View
Returns:
whether or not the view is within zoom mode

toggleZoomMode

public void toggleZoomMode()
Wrapper around the ZoomControllers toggleZoomMode method. Switches the zoom mode for a view between on and off and makes the ZoomController manage the details.

Specified by:
toggleZoomMode in interface View

removeMouseListeners

public abstract void removeMouseListeners()
Removes all mouse listeners. This is for instance necessary when the view switches to zoom mode. (e.g. the DomainTooltipRenderer would mess up the coordinates)

addMouseListeners

public abstract void addMouseListeners()
abstract method to generally register the mouse listeners for a view.
This method is also called each time the zoom mode is disabled.
